Company Description

Crocierissime is part of lm group, publicly traded multinational Group, among the worldwide leaders in the online travel industry.

Every month, the Group reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 60 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to provide our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel related products and services

Job Description

*Please note that this can be a full remote working position*

we are looking for a DevOps dedicated to Azure infrastructure.

"Engineering solutions to design, build, and maintain efficient large-scale systems is a true strategy, and a good one.”

“Hope is not a strategy. Engineering solutions to design, build, and maintain efficient large-scale systems is a true strategy, and a good one.”

Key Responsibilities

  • As DevOps you are responsible for the availability, performances, monitoring and improvement for the azure cloud platform
  • Build and improve infrastructure automation and automate repetitive tasks and build a scalable infrastructure

  • Work closely with development and operation teams for the evolution of architectures and support for projects.

  • Strong experience with automation tools, terraform, ansible, powershell

  • Familiar linux system (centos based)
  • Familiar of Monitoring .net applications
  • Production Support Experience (Systems administration / deployments)
  • Familiarity with version system tools (preferably Git )
  • Ability to debug and optimise code and automate routine tasks
  • Experience with web technologies (headers, cookies, cdn, http/s/2 protocol, ssl)
  • Familiar with SQL language

Desirable

  • Travel domain experience
  • Certifications in the area of expertise (azure cloud)
  • Familiarity with microservices, contracts, REST interfaces
  • Good understanding of hybrid cloud architecture
  • Familiarity Continuous delivery and deployment tools like Jenkins
  • Experience in the programming language .net / core

Abilities/qualities

  • Enthusiasm to learn new technologies

About Us

Court reporting is a $5B+ industry in the United States, with demand steadily increasing and a growing shortage of qualified court reporters available. Parrot is addressing this critical gap in the market by bringing technology to modernize remote proceedings and the transcription process. The result is remote proceedings that are more effective and convenient, and transcriptions that are delivered faster, more accurately and with functionality that saves our customers time and money. Today, law firms, insurance companies, law enforcement and leading corporations rely on Parrot for depositions, examinations under oath, and hearings.

Why Join Us?

We're looking for talented, mission-oriented engineers to join our team of 8 full stack engineers. You'll be building a user-facing web application, internal APIs, integrations with our ML services and whatever else the future brings. In the long term, your responsibilities will include taking end to end ownership of new features, maintaining existing systems, proactively improving the product and bringing your own experience to achieve efficient engineering processes at scale. Our goal is to provide you with extensive onboarding to get you on track and be productive from week 1 at Parrot.

Key Responsibilities

  • Be self sufficient and take responsibility for seeing projects through to successful conclusions
  • Be the gatekeeper of the codebase and ensure that it stays stable, readable, and fun to work on
  • Participate in product decision making, providing feedback and suggestions for improvement
  • Be ready to tackle all sorts of challenges ranging from building APIs, improving server infrastructure or creating user interfaces and iterating on design
  • Perform code reviews for your peers, provide constructive and actionable feedback

Requirements

  • Good communication and writing skills in English
  • Skilled in shifting between system-level thinking and use case-specific design
  • Strong experience building production systems in Python, ideally on the web using Django and Django Rest Framework
  • Experience with front end technologies such as React and TypeScript
  • Using Docker to drive local development as well as deploying containerized services
  • You know your way around Git and GitHub/GitLab or similar
  • Good testing skills; know how and what to test
  • Experience with large, complex code bases and know how to maintain them (Especially ones you haven't written yourself)
  • DevOps experience, including knowledge of performance/scalability best practices

Nice to have

  • Experience operating data infrastructure on Kubernetes
  • You have a good eye for design and usability
  • You are product-oriented and focused on delivering
  • Whatever you're excited about - tell us!

Who We Are

We are a small, fast growing team of operators, technologists, language nerds and legal professionals. We've been remote first from the beginning, well before COVID. We value flexibility and work life balance -- our focus is delivering an exceptional experience for our customers. We are an equal opportunity company and highly value diversity in our team. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you're interested in what we're building, we'd love to connect.

Company Description

WE EMBRACE A TALENT-LED CULTURE

Our work is driven by our team’s desire to be pioneers.

In 2009, we created Robots & Pencils with the then-contrarian view that mobile would be more transformative than the Internet. Turns out we were right.

Today, our thinking is rooted in the belief that, in the age of unprecedented technology acceleration, maintaining a competitive advantage requires new strategies and a focus on innovation.

Our approach has been to create a company designed to follow the talent, allowing us to amass an unfair share of hyper-skilled people who call Robots & Pencils home. A team of people who not only develop innovative solutions to transform businesses, but also create products that have been previously inconceivable.

Our Core Values:

  • Strong Work Ethic

  • Top Drawer

  • Always Learning

  • Heart

  • Discipline

  • Efficacy

Robots & Pencils offers:

We care about Talent. Hard stop.

We do this in many ways, by offering:

  • An attractive compensation package
  • Excellent benefits Medical, Dental, Vision etc. (reviewed each year for enhancements)
  • Paid stat/federal holidays, vacation and sick days
  • Flexible paid stat/federal holidays (because we care about what you care about and want to celebrate our culturally diverse team!)
  • R&P branded swag
  • Parental & adoption leave top up / salary continuance

But we also know a job isn’t just defined by the above, so we pride ourselves in being a company that also offers:

  • A #FollowTheTalent mentality -- meaning you can be located anywhere in North America and work remotely. (We have 10+ years of experience building virtual working environments #WeKnowWhatWereDoing)
  • A dynamic, fast-paced environment where we’re #alwayslearning.
  • And lastly, a team that cares about you and wants to drive the talent experience. How do we do this? Over the years we’ve hosted comedian shows, had holiday parties, happy hours, brunches with the CEO, surprise coffee runs for the team, health & wellness events and prizes, trivia nights, surprise dinners for R&P team members and their family and so much more! And yes, we’ve prioritized a way to do these things in a virtual setting and not just in person - thank you Zoom!



Job Description

You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident.

You know the difference between PUT and PATCH, when to use Cassandra over Redis, and can debate the merits of the CAP theorem. You’re not bound to any one framework; you code in different languages and know the advantages and tradeoffs between threaded parallelization and single threaded event loops. You’re also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality.

What you'll do:

  • Work on Client products as well as our own products, delivering first-class software

  • Build out mobile APIs and web applications for mobile and browser Clients

  • Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code

  • You leverage your own knowledge to teach and mentor other team members

  • Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects



Qualifications
  • 10+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent

  • Fluent understanding of standard Rails methodology and best practices

  • Required skills

    • Rails upgrades from Rails 4

    • Ruby upgrades from 2.4

    • Rake

  • Knowledge of Active Admin and related customizations

  • Heroku experience and knowledge in Vue.js

  • Knowledge of Javascript and front-end frameworks

  • Robust knowledge of some or all of the following preferred: JavaScript, Node.js, AWS, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Cassandra, Git, Client-side JavaScript, and CSS frameworks and tooling

  • Advanced experience in software development design patterns and methodologies

  • Proven working experience in software development and able to mentor peers

  • Ability to take responsibility with testing and behaviour driven development

  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with Clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely



Additional Information

Robots & Pencils aspires to have a workforce that is representative of the diversity of our country and encourages applications from everyone.

"},{"_id":"613f8896c1c0b3646447b0bb","url":"https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/devops/portfolio-solution-architect-for-devops-automation-883736","title":"Portfolio Solution Architect for DevOps & Automation","company_name":"Nordcloud Global","category":"DevOps / Sysadmin","job_type":"full_time","publication_date":"2021-09-12T05:54:36.000Z","candidate_required_location":"EU only","salary":"","description":"

When you join Nordcloud, you become part of a rapidly growing company, where you will set your career on track for outstanding achievement within a company that knows no limits. Our customers are large enterprises seeking to supercharge their digital transformation with the power of cloud and to benefit from the ability to innovate faster than ever.

We are looking for a Portfolio Solutioning Architect in our DevOps & Automation offering area, responsible for growing our business by working closely with Sales and Delivery teams to bring the best Nordcloud has to offer into the hands of our clients. The DevOps & Automation offering is on a mission to let our clients leverage the full potential of the cloud to optimize their time to value and operations.

Your daily work:

  • You lead or contribute to solutioning complex client challenges utilizing your deep knowledge of DevOps & Automation across all hyperscalers.
  • You write crisp proposals which explain the value Nordcloud offers in clear language.
  • You give inspiring pitches in front of clients and actively listen for their wants & needs.
  • You work with our practice & product leaders to identify the right tailoring and extension of their content for market success.
  • You proactively support our offering & product leaders in setting roadmap priorities.
  • You kick-start and coach our delivery teams in key engagements to follow through on our value promise.

To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • Several years of experience in contributing to complex proposals and presenting to clients, from early stages to closing. You apply a challenger approach to solution sales in order to initiate and lead customer dialogue with business and IT stakeholders.
  • Several years of hands-on, cloud-focused experience in one or more of the following areas:
    • CI/CD technologies,
    • Observability & monitoring technologies, or
    • automation technologies.
  • Expertise in Infrastructure as Code.
  • An understanding and passion for increasing and sharing the knowledge of modern cloud-native technologies and how they can empower DevOps teams.
  • Be fluent in discussing Agile methods & frameworks like SAFe, Scrum, and Kanban, and how to unlock value through automation.
  • Are trusted by your customers to deliver what you promise and provide valuable insight and solutions that have an impact on their business.
  • Strong leadership and collaboration skills.
  • Be a team player and target-oriented.
  • Structured and analytical way of working.
  • Excellent communication skills in English and readiness to travel (subject to covid).

Why Nordcloud as your next career move?

  • In this role, you will be in a key position in developing new business and driving productized services for our DevOps & Automation offering
  • Lots of opportunities to develop your expertise and for professional growth. You get access to relevant training & knowledge sharing sessions to support the growth and work with a community of leading cloud professionals. We grow together in our learning community!
  • We have 200+ certified AWS experts, 100+ certified Azure experts, and 70+ certified Google Cloud experts working from 20 different offices in 10 European countries, friendly colleagues comprising 30+ nationalities.
  • We are continuously developing our business – which means we're not stuck with the attitude of doing things as they've always been done.
  • Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools and ways of working.
  • Wide range of benefits like private health care, certificates paid, wellness & public transportation benefits, high-end laptop and a smartphone of your choice, etc.
  • Events & fun – besides all your interesting work assignments, feel free to enjoy our extra-curricular activities such as clubs, virtual coffees, after work, etc. And of course, we welcome new activities open-heartedly if you have anything in mind!

To get more insight into the daily life at Nordcloud community, check out our Community & Culture site, Instagram profile, Facebook and LinkedIn.

Please read our Data Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in the EU.

About Nordcloud

Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It's a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. As well as partnering with VMware, Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon Web Services – and is featured in Gartner's Magic Quadrant. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 500 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from mid-size to large corporates. IBM announced its acquisition of Nordcloud on December 21, 2020.

Ally Right is the world’s first website compliance and security management software powered by Artificial Intelligence. In addition to creating an amazing software, we are actively working to make the world more inclusive to all. We work with nonprofit organizations that improve the lives of people with disabilities, as well as nonprofits working to break the gender pay gap.

We are based in California and have team members in 5 different time zones.

This is a very exciting time!

We are launching the software and are looking for talented people to join us in our quest to make the world more inclusive to all.



Job Description

Do you have great passion for design and enjoy creating beautiful and intuitive UI/UX and print materials?

If you are passionate about design and improving people's lives and want to work from your home, read on. You might be who we are looking for.

We are looking for a freelance graphic designer to create web, marketing and brand materials across multiple mediums, this includes:

* pages for our website (no coding needed, just design)

* graphics for social media

* email designs

* images for our blog

* flyers and brochures

* other assets as needed

1) What is your style?

2) How long have you been designing?

3) Are you an expert in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, and Figma?

4) Can you work on Pacific Time when needed?

5) When can you start?



Qualifications

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, constantly creating different assets

* Ability to work fast, sending different versions and mockups in a timely manner

* Positive and calm attitude, making recommendations on how to improve our look and feel

* Expertise in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, and Figma

* Very organized and attentive to the smallest details

* Self-motivated, you can work autonomously but also communicate early and often

* Clear communication is extremely important

Bonus Points

* Bachelor’s Degree in design or a related field

* Proficiency in After Effects and Premiere

* Basic knowledge in WordPress, HTML, and CSS
